name: Health@Home
0:
”Alexa, ask Health at Home for my last measurement.”
”Alexa, ask Health at Home for my address.”
”Alexa, tell Health at Home to reboot.”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: health at home
des:
The Health@Home skill lets you control and request information from your Health@Home personal health gateway (PHG, also known as a hub). It must be linked to your PHG user account on Health@Home Exchange. The account credentials should be provided to you by your Health@Home Exchange program administrator. Tap the "Enable to Use" button on the skill's page in the Alexa app and log in to your PHG user account when prompted.

You can only issue commands to your PHG when it is online and connected to Health@Home Exchange.

Here's what you can do with the Health@Home skill:

Get information about your PHG:
* Alexa, ask Health at Home for my account name - Alexa responds with the Exchange PHG user account you linked your Amazon account to
* Alexa, ask Health at Home for my IP address
* Alexa, ask Health at Home for my sticker number - Alexa gives the ID on the sticker which is located on the bottom of the PHG2000L
* Alexa, ask Health at Home if my hub is online

Safely reboot or turn off your PHG:
* Alexa, tell Health at Home to reboot
* Alexa, tell Health at Home to shut down

Enroll patients and identify measurements:
* Alexa, tell Health at Home to enroll (your first name) - This command must be given within 60 seconds of initiating the enrolling process on the PHG via the local GUI
* Alexa, tell Health at Home that the measurement is for (your first name) - Must be given within 60 seconds of taking a measurement

Review your measurements:
* Alexa, ask Health at Home for my last measurement

Pair health devices:
* Alexa, tell Health at Home to pair my device - The PHG attempts to pair with the next health device it sees.
* Alexa, tell Health at Home to pair my device using PIN 123456
* Alexa, tell Health at Home to cancel pairing
* Alexa, ask Health at Home if my device is paired
* Alexa, tell Health at Home to unpair my device - Useful if "pair my device" picked the wrong device.
